name: Yi Wu 0020
content: Yi Wu's Homepage Yi Wu | 武艺 Assistant Professor @University of Oklahoma Ph.D. @University of Tennessee, Knoxville Greetings! Welcome to my homepage. I am an Assistant Professor in the Computer Science department at University of Oklahoma. Previously, I was a Postdoctoral Researcher in the Center of Data Science at Emory University, working with Dr. Xiao Hu. I completed my Ph.D. at Min H. Kao Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at University of Tennessee, Knoxville, under supervison of Dr. Jian Liu. My research interests encompass the areas of mobile sensing & computing, human-computer interaction, and cybersecurity & privacy. Particularly, I utilize machine learning and signal processing techniques to create next-generation applications for human-computer interaction, smart health monitoring, and identifying potential security/privacy issues on IoT devices. My research work has been published at top-tier mobile-computing/security/HCI venues, including S&P/Oakland, ACM CCS, ACM MobiCom, ACM UbiComp, and ACSAC. I will not be recruiting new Ph.D. students for Fall 2026. Thank you for your understanding. Recent News [Sep. 2025] One paper accepted to TS4H NeurIPS 2025 (Workshop). [July 2025] One article published at SIAM News. [July 2025] One paper accepted to Raid 2025. [June 2025] One paper accepted to UbiComp / ISWC 2025. [May 2025] Invited to deliever a talk on security & privacy issues in VR and wireless charging at University of Oklahoma (Cybersecurity Essential Training Workshop). [Apr. 2025] Invited to serve as a panelist for an NSF review panel. [Mar. 2025] Invited to serve on the TPC for ACSAC 2025. [Mar. 2025] Invited to serve on the TPC for IEEE COMPSAC 2025. [Oct. 2024] Invited to deliever a talk on sensing opportunities and security issues in VR/AR at University of North Texas (Data Science Talk Series). [Oct. 2024] One paper accepted to IEEE Transactions on Mobile Computing (TMC). [July 2024] Successfully defended my Ph.D. dissertation! [July 2023] I will join Truveta this fall as a research intern, working on LLM pre-training, LLM fine-tuning, and medical image de-identification. [July 2023] One paper accepted to UbiComp / ISWC 2023. [May 2023] One paper accepted to ACM DRONET 2023. [Mar. 2023] One paper accepted to IEEE S&P 2023. [Feb. 2023] I will join Snap Research this summer as a research intern, working with the Computational Imaging team. [Apr. 2022] BioFace-3D has been selected as the SigMobile Research Highlights 2022. [Aug. 2021] One paper accepted to ACSAC 2021. [Aug. 2021] Two papers accepted to ACM MobiCom 2021. I enjoy watching movies & reading detective fictions in my leisure time. "The Pursuit of Happyness", "Batman: The Dark Knight" and "Tokyo Godfathers" are my favourites. I also enjoy swimming & watching NBA games.
